title: Dijkstra's Algorithm
description: Dijkstra's algorithm finds the shortest path from a source node to all other nodes in a weighted graph with non-negative edge weights.
keyPoints: Uses a priority queue (min-heap) for efficiency.
Does not work with negative edge weights.
Returns shortest path distances from the source to all nodes.
pseudocode:
1. Set distance to source as 0, all others as infinity.
2. Use a min-priority queue to select the node with the smallest distance.
3. For each neighbor, update distance if a shorter path is found.
4. Repeat until all nodes are visited.
edgeCases: Graphs with negative weights (use Bellman-Ford instead)
Disconnected graphs (some nodes may remain at infinity)
